item.title: New dues payment option: Bitcoin!
item.description:
By popular demand, members may now pay their monthly dues through BitPay, a global bitcoin payment service provider. This is currently a surcharge-free payment method, i.e. not subject to the 3% payment processing fee.

BitPay payment links may be found on our Treasurer Operations wiki page.

We now welcome …
item.dc:creator: rtucker

item.title: Keeping it together with Trello
item.description: At our December monthly meeting, Joe Hale demonstrated Trello, a web-based productivity system based on the supply-chain management concept of *kanban*.  A Trello board is made of "lists" of self-contained "cards." Each card should have all of the information needed to take action, such as to-do checklists, photos, links to …
item.dc:creator: rtucker

item.title: Knitting at Interlock
item.description:
During the fall, roughly September through December, a group of folks are gathering on Sunday afternoons to knit. Learn how to knit, hang out with other knitters, share project ideas, or trade yarn! Meet-up time is roughly 1pm on Sundays at Interlock Rochester, Suite 200, Door 7, Hungerford Building.

For …
item.dc:creator: rtucker

item.title: Blitzortung: Crowd-sourced global lightning detection
item.description: Lightning is one of nature’s most fascinating phenomena. In less than a millisecond, a kilometers-long plasma channel sinks an unimaginable electrical current from a cloud to the ground, unleashing vast amounts of energy in a very short period of time. Nearby observers will see a brilliant flash of light …
item.dc:creator: rtucker
